conclusion: Analyze the paths and directions of the liquid flow to determine which container it will flow into.
The arrows at the top indicate the direction of liquid flow from each baffle (A, B, C, D).
Liquid from A flows downward and to the left, likely reaching container E.
Liquid from B flows downward and slightly to the right, likely reaching container F.
Liquid from C flows downward and to the right, likely reaching container G.
Liquid from D flows downward and to the right, likely reaching container G.
The baffles are positioned in a way that directs the flow based on their angles and positions.
C and D direct to G.
Container E will receive liquid from A.
Container F will receive liquid from B.
Container G will receive liquid from C and D.
